text: Periodic acid (pronounced as per·io'·dic acid) is a chemical compound. It is also an acid. Its chemical formula is HIO4 or H5IO6. It has hydrogen and periodate ions in it. ==Properties== Periodic acid is found as a colorless solution. It is a strong oxidizing agent, like perchloric acid. It breaks down when heated to iodine pentoxide and oxygen, as well as water. It does not form . It is found as in dilute solution and in concentrated solution. When is heated, it turns into . ==Preparation== It is made by reacting a periodate with a strong acid. ==Uses== It is used to look at the structure of certain organic compounds. ==Related pages== *Perbromic acid *Sodium perbromate *Iodic acid Category:Iodine compounds Category:Oxoacids
title: Periodic acid
